Statement: It is not necessary that the cells in the elephant be much bigger than those in a rat
The blood cell is a membrane which separates the blood cell from the blood and the blood from the plasma
Different cells in different tissues are also enclosed in cell wall
Nucleus is generally spherical and located in the centre of the cell
There is an outer thick layer in cells of plants called cell wall
Each organ is further made up of smaller parts called tissues
The entire content of a living cell includes the membrane and the nucleus.
The size of cells in living organisms may be as large as a sixth of a metre (micrometre or micron) or as small as a few centimetres.
The size of the cells has bearing with the growth of the body of the animal or plant.
Brain cell is an important part of human body and the plasma is a part of the organ of human blood.
